TextFilter
public class ParamTextFilter
extends AbstractTextFilter

Message filter that substitutes parameters.

createParam

protected ParamTextFilter.Param createParam(String param)
Creates a parameter object for the specified string parameter.

Supports the following parameter types:

param
Standard parameter.
param?text
Optional parameter, uses the text supplied if there parameter value exists or the empty string if there is no such parameter or the parameter value is empty.
param!text
Default parameter, behaves like the standard parameter for existing, non-empty parameters. If the parameter does not exist or its value is empty uses the default text supplied.

Replacement values are obtained using paramValue(String).

The text in the optional and default parameters may use the backslash as escape sequence for PARAM_END.

Note:

The parameter prefix and suffix are already removed in the string passed in.

Parameters:
param - the parameter for which to create the parameter object.
Returns:
the parameter object, must not be null.
Since:
1.6.0

replaceParams

protected String replaceParams(String text)
Replaces all parameters in the specified text.

Uses PARAM_START and PARAM_END to determine the parameters contained in the text.

Replaces parameters found with values obtained using paramValue(String).

Supported parameter types include those created by createParam(String).

Parameters:
text - the text for which to replace the parameters.
Returns:
the text with the replaced parameters.
Since:
1.6.0
